entry.title: WINTER STORM WARNING , St. John's
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 5:27 PM NST Monday 13 February 2023

entry.title: Current Conditions: Mostly Cloudy, -4.8°C
entry.summary:
Observed at: St. John's Int'l Airport 10:30 PM NST Monday 13 February 2023
Condition: Mostly Cloudy
Temperature: -4.8°C
Pressure / Tendency: 101.1 kPa falling
Visibility: 24.1 km
Humidity: 86 %
Wind Chill: -13
Dewpoint: -6.8°C
Wind: E 30 km/h gust 40 km/h
Air Quality Health Index: 3

entry.title: Monday night: Snow at times heavy and blowing snow. Low minus 5.
entry.summary: Increasing cloudiness. Snow at times heavy and blowing snow beginning after midnight. Amount 5 to 10 cm. Wind west 20 km/h gusting to 40 becoming northeast 20 gusting to 40 this evening then east 40 gusting to 60 overnight. Low minus 5. Wind chill minus 8 this evening and minus 13 overnight. Forecast issued 4:00 PM NST Monday 13 February 2023

entry.title: Tuesday: Snow at times heavy mixed with ice pellets. High minus 1.
entry.summary: Snow at times heavy or ice pellets. Freezing rain along the southern shore. Blowing snow. Snow and ice pellet amount 15 cm except 5 cm along the southern shore. Wind east 50 km/h gusting to 70 becoming northeast 40 gusting to 60 near noon. High minus 1. Wind chill near minus 12. UV index 1 or low. Forecast issued 4:00 PM NST Monday 13 February 2023

entry.title: Tuesday night: Snow at times heavy mixed with ice pellets. Temperature steady near minus 1.
entry.summary: Snow at times heavy. Snow or ice pellets early in the evening. Blowing snow. Snow and ice pellet amount 10 cm except 5 cm along the southern shore. Wind northeast 40 km/h gusting to 60 becoming northwest 50 gusting to 80 overnight. Temperature steady near minus 1. Wind chill near minus 10. Forecast issued 4:00 PM NST Monday 13 February 2023

entry.title: Wednesday: Chance of flurries. High minus 1. POP 60%
